alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern King and Queen; Middlesex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 4:25PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN GLOUCESTER... NORTHWESTERN MIDDLESEX...EAST CENTRAL KING AND QUEEN...SOUTHEASTERN ESSEX AND WESTERN LANCASTER COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM EDT... At 425 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over Jamaica, or 9 miles northeast of King And Queen Court House, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Urbanna, Church View, Jamaica, Little Plymouth, Saluda, Laneview, Nesting, Bowlers Wharf, Ino, Dragonville, Montague, Warner, Mascot, Velma, Remlik, Water View, Samos, and Clancie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Eastern King and Queen; Middlesex
